content.title: Practice knowledge test
content.failingResultsBody: A passing score of 80% is required on the real test.
content.message: Need to study before your knowledge test? Check out the Learn to Drive Smart Manual.

text.default: To identify hazards in your surroundings while driving, you should
text.mandarin: 在驾驶时，要识别周边的危险，你应该

answer.default: scan the driving environment regularly
answer.mandarin: 定期扫描驾驶环境

distractor_1.default: only keep your eyes directly on the road ahead
distractor_1.mandarin: 只将你的目光直接放在前方的道路上

distractor_2.default: avoid using your rear view mirrors

distractor_3.default: tune your radio to receive local traffic information
distractor_3.mandarin: 调整你的收音机以接收本地交通信息

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do
question.source: Do not overdrive your ability to see. You should always be able to prepare for a potential hazard instead of being taken by surprise.

text.default: On a vehicle with AUTOMATIC transmission, when should the first and second DRIVE (D1, D2) gears be used
text.mandarin:
在自动变速箱的车辆上，第一档和第二档驱动档（D1，D2）应在以下情况下使用
On a vehicle with AUTOMATIC transmission, when should the first and second DRIVE (D1, D2) gears be used

answer.default: when pulling heavy loads or when going up or down very steep hills.
answer.mandarin: 在拖拉重载或者上下非常陡峭的山坡时。

distractor_1.default: when exiting a highway.

distractor_2.default: when parking your vehicle.

distractor_3.default: when it is raining.

question.chapter: Chapter 2: You and Your Vehicle; Comparing Automatic and Standard Transmissions
question.source: There are two types of transmissions: automatic and standard. Both control the connection between the engine and the wheels.

text.default: Which of the following is NOT part of the pre-trip check you should do EVERY time you drive?
text.mandarin: 以下哪项不是您每次驾驶前应进行的出行前检查的一部分？

answer.default: Check radiator fluid and oil levels.
answer.mandarin: 检查冷却液和油位。

distractor_1.default: Check side and rear view mirrors are properly adjusted.
distractor_1.mandarin: 检查侧视镜和后视镜是否调整正确。

distractor_2.default: Check head rest and seat belts are properly adjusted.
distractor_2.mandarin: 检查头枕和安全带是否调整正确。

distractor_3.default: Check lights and turn signals.

question.chapter: Chapter 2: You and Your Vehicle; Pre-trip Check.
question.source: To ensure good maintenance, you need to do a more thorough pre-trip check every few weeks.

text.default: Seat belts are most effective in preventing injury when
text.mandarin: 安全带在以下情况下最能有效预防伤害

answer.default: the lap belt and shoulder strap are worn correctly.
answer.mandarin: 腰带和肩带正确佩戴时。

distractor_1.default: the head rest is fully extended.

distractor_2.default: the seat is moved fully forward.

distractor_3.default: the seat is tilted back slightly.

question.chapter: Chapter 2: You and Your Vehicle; Seatbelts
question.source: Wearing a seatbelt significantly reduces your chance of serious injury or death in a crash.

text.default: As a driver you should
text.mandarin: 作为驾驶员，您应该

answer.default: constantly check the sides of the road and all of your mirrors, as well as the road ahead
answer.mandarin: 不断检查道路两侧及所有的后视镜，以及前方的道路

distractor_1.default: carefully watch the car behind you

distractor_2.default: carefully watch the car ahead of you

distractor_3.default: rarely look in your mirrors

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: It is important that you pay attention to things outside your central vision. Peripheral vision allows you to see more than what is directly in front of you.

text.default: When making a right turn, you should shoulder check to
text.mandarin: 当您右转时，您应该肩部检查以

answer.default: make sure a cyclist or other road user is not beside you
answer.mandarin: 确保没有自行车手或其他道路使用者在您旁边

distractor_1.default: make sure you are in the proper lane
distractor_1.mandarin: 确保您处于正确的车道

distractor_2.default: warn the car behind of your intent to turn
distractor_2.mandarin: 警告后面的车辆您打算转弯

distractor_3.default: make sure the car behind you is not too close
distractor_3.mandarin: 确保您后面的车辆不太靠近

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Whenever you plan a change in direction or road position, do a shoulder check to make sure the blind spot on that side is clear.

text.default: The correct See-Think-Do strategy for the driver of Car A is?
text.mandarin: 汽车A的驾驶员正确的“看-想-做”策略是？

answer.default: Sees that Car B is close behind; thinks, "I need more space."; slows and gradually leaves a bigger cushion in front.
answer.mandarin: 看到汽车B紧跟在后；想到，“我需要更多的空间。”；减速并逐渐在前方留出更大的缓冲区。

distractor_1.default: Sees that Car B is close behind; thinks, "I need to get away."; accelerates to leave more space behind.
distractor_1.mandarin: 看到汽车B紧跟在后；想到，“我需要脱身。”；加速以在后方留出更多空间。

distractor_2.default: Sees there is small gap to the right of Truck C; thinks, "I can squeeze through there."; accelerates and changes lanes.
distractor_2.mandarin: 看到卡车C右侧有小空隙；想到，“我可以挤过去。”；加速并变道。

distractor_3.default: Sees that Car B is close behind; thinks, "I need more space."; brakes suddenly to scare driver of Car B.
distractor_3.mandarin: 看到汽车B紧跟在后；想到，“我需要更多空间。”；突然刹车以吓到汽车B的驾驶员。

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do
question.source: it's a good idea to slow down slightly to increase your space in front. This way, if you have to stop, you can stop more gradually ...

text.default: When do you NOT need to make a shoulder check?
text.mandarin: 在什么情况下你不需要做肩部检查？

answer.default: When judging your following distance.
answer.mandarin: 当判断你的跟车距离时。

distractor_1.default: When you pull out from the side of the road.

distractor_2.default: When you pull over to the side of the road.

distractor_3.default: When you change lanes.

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Whenever you plan a change in direction or road position, do a shoulder check to make sure the blind spot on that side is clear.

text.default: There is a vehicle directly in the blind spot of Car A, which one is it?
text.mandarin: 直接在汽车A的盲点中的是哪辆车？

answer.default: Car D
answer.mandarin: 汽车D

distractor_1.default: Car C

distractor_2.default: Car B

distractor_3.default: Car E

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Even when your mirrors are properly adjusted, there are large areas that you can't see in your mirrors. These are called blind spots.

text.default: The best way to check for vehicles in the blind spots is by
text.mandarin: 检查盲点中的车辆最好的方式是通过

answer.default: looking over your shoulder
answer.mandarin: 越过你的肩膀看

distractor_1.default: keeping clear of other vehicles

distractor_2.default: checking side and rearview mirrors

distractor_3.default: scanning for blind spots ahead of you

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Whenever you plan a change in direction or road position, do a shoulder check to make sure the blind spot on that side is clear.

text.default: Reaction time is affected most after
text.mandarin: 反应时间受到以下情况影响最大

answer.default: drinking alcohol
answer.mandarin: 饮酒后

distractor_1.default: exercising

distractor_2.default: sleeping

distractor_3.default: working hard

question.chapter: Chapter 7: Personal Strategies; Facts About Alcohol
question.source: In some cases, even small amounts of alcohol can cause a driver to be impaired.

text.default: What is this cyclist going to do?
text.mandarin: 这位骑自行车的人将要做什么？

answer.default: Stop or slow down.
answer.mandarin: 停下或减速。

distractor_1.default: Turn right.

distractor_2.default: Turn left.

distractor_3.default: Let you pass.

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Communication
question.source: This section has an illustration that shows how cyclists signal left turns, right turns, and stopping or slowing down.

text.default: A driver should not change lanes
text.mandarin: 驾驶员不应该在以下情况下变换车道

answer.default: in intersections
answer.mandarin: 在交叉路口

distractor_1.default: at less than 50km/h

distractor_2.default: at more than 80km/h

distractor_3.default: in hospital zones

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road
question.source: Don't change lanes at an intersection. You could confuse other drivers and cause a crash.

text.default: Unless otherwise posted, the speed limit WITHIN cities and towns is
text.mandarin: 除非另有标示，城镇内的速度限制是

answer.default: 50km/h
answer.mandarin: 50公里/小时

distractor_1.default: 30km/h

distractor_2.default: 60km/h

distractor_3.default: 80km/h

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Speed Control
question.source: Unless a sign tells you otherwise, the speed limit is 50km/h within cities and towns.

text.default: What should the driver of Car A do?
text.mandarin: 汽车A的驾驶员应该怎么做？

answer.default: Slow down to allow Car B safe entry.
answer.mandarin: 减速以允许汽车B安全进入。

distractor_1.default: Speed up to get ahead of merging Car B.
distractor_1.mandarin: 加速以超过正在合并的汽车B。

distractor_2.default: Slow down, honk, and wave Car B in.
distractor_2.mandarin: 减速，按喇叭，并向汽车B挥手。

distractor_3.default: Maintain speed.

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Highway or Freeway Entrances and Exits
question.source: When you are driving in the right lane of a freeway, other drivers may try to merge from an entrance lane. It's not always easy for them to find a safe gap.

text.default: Before you pull out to pass, you should
text.mandarin: 在你开始超车之前，你应该

answer.default: be able to see well ahead
answer.mandarin: 能够清楚地看到前方

distractor_1.default: get close to the vehicle ahead

distractor_2.default: wait for a signal from the driver ahead

distractor_3.default: speed up and watch carefully

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Assess the Risk
question.source: In assessing just how risky this situation is, you should ask yourself what could happen. What if there is an unexpected obstacle just around the curve?

text.default: You should NOT pass another vehicle
text.mandarin: 你不应该在以下情况超过其他车辆

answer.default: when your vision is obstructed
answer.mandarin: 当你的视线受阻时

distractor_1.default: on an unfamiliar road
distractor_1.mandarin: 在一条不熟悉的道路上

distractor_2.default: on a 2-lane road at night

distractor_3.default: on a multi-lane one way street

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Hazard Perception
question.source: Be extra cautious when anything blocks your view. Never pass when you are approaching the top of a hill.

text.default: It is illegal to exceed the posted speed limit
text.mandarin: 超过指示的速度限制是非法的

answer.default: at all times
answer.mandarin: 始终

distractor_1.default: except in remote or unpopulated areas
distractor_1.mandarin: 除了在偏远或无人居住的地区

distractor_2.default: except when you are keeping up with traffic

distractor_3.default: except when passing

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Speed Control
question.source: The posted speed is the maximum for ideal conditions only. Choose a lower speed if the conditions are not ideal.

text.default: If you are behind a large vehicle or a motorcycle on a high speed road, your following distance should be at LEAST
text.mandarin: 如果你在高速公路上跟在一辆大型车辆或摩托车后面，你的跟车距离至少应该是

answer.default: 3 seconds
answer.mandarin: 3秒钟

distractor_1.default: 4 seconds

distractor_2.default: 2 seconds

distractor_3.default: 6 seconds

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Allow at least three seconds following distance when you are behind a large vehicle that could block your vision or a motorcycle that could stop very quickly.

text.default: In bad weather or slippery conditions on high speed roads, your following distance should be at LEAST
text.mandarin: 在恶劣天气或高速公路上的湿滑路况下，你的跟车距离至少应该是

answer.default: 4 seconds
answer.mandarin: 4秒钟

distractor_1.default: 2 seconds

distractor_2.default: 6 seconds

distractor_3.default: 8 seconds

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Increase your following distance to three seconds on high-speed roads and to four seconds in bad weather conditions or on uneven or slippery roads.

text.default: Pedestrians and cyclists are most at risk from vehicles because
text.mandarin: 行人和骑自行车的人最容易受到车辆的威胁，因为

answer.default: they are more likely to be severely injured in a crash than car drivers and passengers
answer.mandarin: 他们在事故中更有可能受到严重伤害，而不像汽车司机和乘客

distractor_1.default: they are not required to follow the rules of the road
distractor_1.mandarin: 他们不需要遵守道路规则

distractor_2.default: they are more often at fault when crashes occur
distractor_2.mandarin: 他们在事故发生时更经常有过错

distractor_3.default: they are slower

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road
question.source: Of all road users, pedestrians are among the most vulnerable. You always need to watch out for them. Pedestrians, like all road users, can be unpredictable.

text.default: What is the most immediate danger to Cyclist A?
text.mandarin: 自行车手A面临的最直接危险是什么？

answer.default: The driver of Car B may not see Cyclist A and turn into its path.
answer.mandarin: 汽车B的驾驶员可能没有注意到自行车手A并转向其行驶路径。

distractor_1.default: The pedestrian may move into Cyclist A's path.
distractor_1.mandarin: 行人可能会走入自行车手A的行驶路径。

distractor_2.default: The driver of Car C may drive into the back of Cyclist A.
distractor_2.mandarin: 汽车C的驾驶员可能会撞上自行车手A的后方。

distractor_3.default: The driver of Car D will turn left.

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: Be aware that cyclists don't always stay on the right. To make a left turn, for instance, they need to move over to the left lane.

text.default: You MUST stop for a school bus
text.mandarin: 你必须停下来给校车让路

answer.default: when its red lights are flashing
answer.mandarin: 当它的红灯在闪烁时

distractor_1.default: at all times

distractor_2.default: when it is carrying children

distractor_3.default: when it is waiting by a school

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; School buses
question.source: Stop whenever you see flashing lights on a school bus.

text.default: If you see pedestrians at the side of the road and wanting to jaywalk you should
text.mandarin: 如果你看到路边的行人想要横穿马路，你应该

answer.default: slow down and be ready to stop
answer.mandarin: 减速并准备停车

distractor_1.default: maintain your speed as you have the right of way
distractor_1.mandarin: 保持你的速度，因为你有通行权

distractor_2.default: always stop and yield the right of way

distractor_3.default: slow down and wave them across

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Pedestrians
question.source: You must always be prepared to stop if you see a pedestrian who is about to step out in front of you. However, don't encourage jaywalking.

text.default: Pedestrians with a white cane should be treated with extra care because
text.mandarin: 持白色手杖的行人应该被特别小心对待，因为

answer.default: they might be uncertain when crossing a street
answer.mandarin: 他们在过马路时可能会感到不确定

distractor_1.default: they will walk across a street at any point
distractor_1.mandarin: 他们会在任何地方横穿马路

distractor_2.default: they do not have to follow the rules of the road
distractor_2.mandarin: 他们不必遵守道路规则

distractor_3.default: they will not hear your vehicle
distractor_3.mandarin: 他们听不到你的车辆声音

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Pedestrians
question.source: Often, a blind or partially blind person will raise their cane when uncertain of crossing the street safely. That is your signal to stop.

text.default: Which car does NOT have an escape route if a problem occurs ahead?
text.mandarin: 如果前方发生问题，哪辆车没有逃生路线？

answer.default: Car A
answer.mandarin: 汽车A

distractor_1.default: Car B

distractor_2.default: Car C

distractor_3.default: Car D

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Try to leave yourself an escape route when you are driving on a multi-lane highway. Then, if something happens in front, you can pull into another lane.

text.default: Car A
text.mandarin: 汽车A

answer.default: may not pass
answer.mandarin: 可能不会通过

distractor_1.default: may pass with caution

distractor_2.default: may pass on the right

distractor_3.default: may not turn left over the line

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Yellow lines divide traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken line and a solid line mean you may pass only when it is safe and the broken line is on your side.

text.default: This sign means
text.mandarin: 这个标志的意思是

answer.default: road narrows ahead
answer.mandarin: 前方道路变窄

distractor_1.default: divided highway ends ahead

distractor_2.default: lane ends ahead

distractor_3.default: narrow structure ahead

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Most warning signs are yellow and diamond-shaped. They warn of possible hazards ahead.

text.default: Making eye contact with cyclists around your vehicle
text.mandarin: 与你车辆周围的骑自行车者进行眼神交流

answer.default: is a good means of communication
answer.mandarin: 是一种良好的沟通方式

distractor_1.default: may cause them to lose balance
distractor_1.mandarin: 可能导致他们失去平衡

distractor_2.default: may distract you

distractor_3.default: is not useful

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: A cyclist often relies on eye contact as a means of communication. Make eye contact if you can. She or he is probably trying to anticipate your next move.

text.default: If you notice a driver who is steering side to side or stopping without reason, you should
text.mandarin: 如果你注意到一个司机左右摇晃方向盘或没有原因地停车，你应该

answer.default: give yourself extra space
answer.mandarin: 给自己额外的空间

distractor_1.default: follow them to their destination

distractor_2.default: honk at them

distractor_3.default: flash your lights and pass them

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Hazard Perception
question.source: To avoid surprises, think well ahead and ask yourself what could possibly happen in the driving environment.

text.default: Stopped public transit buses
text.mandarin: 停在路边的公共交通巴士

answer.default: may hide pedestrians who are preparing to cross
answer.mandarin: 可能会隐藏准备过马路的行人

distractor_1.default: require you to stop behind them

distractor_2.default: can't see vehicles that will pass them
distractor_2.mandarin: 看不到会超越它们的车辆

distractor_3.default: have to honk before pulling into traffic
distractor_3.mandarin: 在进入交通之前必须按喇叭

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Public Transit Buses
question.source: Watch for buses that have stopped -- they may block your view of pedestrians about to cross the street, or they may be about to pull into traffic.

text.default: When pulling out of a driveway on to a street with a sidewalk, what must the driver of Car A do before entering the street?
text.mandarin: 当从车道驶出驶入带有人行道的街道时，汽车A的驾驶员必须在进入街道之前做什么？

answer.default: stop before the sidewalk
answer.mandarin: 在人行道前停车

distractor_1.default: be prepared to stop, but continue into the street if no hazard is identified.
distractor_1.mandarin: 准备停车，但如果没有识别到危险，就继续进入街道。

distractor_2.default: slow down and proceed with caution

distractor_3.default: stop just past the sidewalk before entering the street
distractor_3.mandarin: 在进入街道前刚好停在人行道的后面

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: When you are pulling out of a driveway, alley or parking lot onto a road, stop before the sidewalk or area where pedestrians may be walking.

text.default: Your space margins are the distance between
text.mandarin: 你的空间边距是指

answer.default: your vehicle and other road users
answer.mandarin: 你的车辆和其他道路使用者之间的距离

distractor_1.default: your vehicle and the vehicle ahead of you
distractor_1.mandarin: 你的车辆和你前面的车辆之间的距离

distractor_2.default: your vehicle and the vehicle behind you
distractor_2.mandarin: 你的车辆和你后面的车辆之间的距离

distractor_3.default: your vehicle and the curb
distractor_3.mandarin: 你的车辆和路缘之间的距离

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: You must have room to move if you need it. Space margins include your space in front, behind, beside and your lane position.

text.default: One danger of driving too close to the car in front of you is
text.mandarin: 驾驶过于靠近前面的车辆的一个危险是

answer.default: you may not be able to see what is up ahead
answer.mandarin: 你可能无法看到前方的情况

distractor_1.default: you will block the rear view mirror of the car in front
distractor_1.mandarin: 你会挡住前面车辆的后视镜

distractor_2.default: you will force the car in front to speed up
distractor_2.mandarin: 你会迫使前面的车辆加速

distractor_3.default: you will be in the blind spot of the car in front
distractor_3.mandarin: 你会处于前面车辆的盲点

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Tailgating (following too closely behind the vehicle in front) is a major cause of crashes. If you tailgate, the vehicle in front can block your view of hazards ahead.

text.default: Drivers should give cyclists extra room because they
text.mandarin: 司机应该给骑自行车的人更多的空间，因为他们

answer.default: might swerve or change lanes
answer.mandarin: 可能会突然转向或变道

distractor_1.default: often stop suddenly

distractor_2.default: often ride two abreast

distractor_3.default: do not have to follow the same rules of the road
distractor_3.mandarin: 不必遵守同样的道路规则

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: Allow side margins - a significant number of crashes involving cyclists result from side-swiping. Make sure there is enough space if you want to pass a cyclist.

text.default: This car may
text.mandarin: 这辆车可能会

answer.default: not pass but can turn left over the line
answer.mandarin: 不可以超车，但可以左转越线

distractor_1.default: pass but can't turn left over the line
distractor_1.mandarin: 可以超车，但不能左转越线

distractor_2.default: not pass or turn left over the line
distractor_2.mandarin: 不可以超车或左转越线

distractor_3.default: pass and turn left over the line

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Yellow lines divide traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken line and a solid line mean you may pass only when it is safe and the broken line is on your side.

text.default: You should never sneak behind a truck when it is backing up because
text.mandarin: 当卡车正在倒车时，你不应该从后面悄悄接近，因为

answer.default: it is dangerous if you enter one of its blind spots
answer.mandarin: 如果你进入其中一个盲区，会很危险

distractor_1.default: they have a less effective braking system than cars
distractor_1.mandarin: 它们的制动系统比汽车效果更差

distractor_2.default: they carry more weight than your vehicle
distractor_2.mandarin: 它们比你的车辆承载更多的重量

distractor_3.default: the truck may create too much turbulence
distractor_3.mandarin: 卡车可能会产生过多的湍流

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Large Vehicles
question.source: Never try to sneak behind a truck if it is backing into a loading bay or out of a driveway because you will enter one of the truck driver's blind spots and risk being hit.

text.default: You are driving along a multi-lane one way street. You see an emergency vehicle with lights flashing in your rear view mirror. You should
text.mandarin: 你正在沿着一条多车道单向街道行驶。你在后视镜里看到一辆紧急车辆的灯光在闪烁。你应该

answer.default: move safely to either side of the road and stop
answer.mandarin: 安全地移动到路的任意一侧并停车

distractor_1.default: be ready to get out of the way

distractor_2.default: slow down and move to either side of the road
distractor_2.mandarin: 减速并移动到路的任意一侧

distractor_3.default: stop immediately

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Emergency Vehicles
question.source: Usually the best thing to do is pull over to the right and stop (or to the left if you're driving in the left lane of a divided highway or on a one-way street).

text.default: The traffic light for Car A has just turned green. An ambulance with flashing lights is coming up from behind. What should Car A do?
text.mandarin: 车辆A的交通信号灯刚刚变绿。一辆带有闪烁灯光的救护车从后方驶来。车辆A应该怎么做？

answer.default: Turn right to clear a path for the ambulance.
answer.mandarin: 向右转，为救护车让路。

distractor_1.default: Back up and pull over to the curb.

distractor_2.default: Honk at Car C to pull over to the curb.

distractor_3.default: Speed up through the intersection

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Emergency Vehicles
question.source: If you are stopped at an intersection and you are blocking the path of the emergency vehicle, you may have to turn the corner to get out of the way.

text.default: You are driving in the LEFT lane of a DIVIDED highway. You see an emergency vehicle with lights flashing in your rear view mirror. You should
text.mandarin: 你正在行驶在分隔的公路的左车道。你在后视镜里看到一辆带有闪烁灯光的紧急车辆。你应该

answer.default: move safely to the nearest edge of the road and stop
answer.mandarin: 安全地移动到最近的路边并停车

distractor_1.default: slow down and move to either side of the road
distractor_1.mandarin: 减速并移动到路的任意一侧

distractor_2.default: stop immediately

distractor_3.default: be ready to get out of the way

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Emergency Vehicles
question.source: Usually the best thing to do is pull over to the right and stop (or to the left if you are driving in the left lane of a divided highway or on a one-way street).

text.default: To make a left turn at this intersection, Vehicle A should
text.mandarin: 在这个十字路口左转，车辆A应该

answer.default: move to the left lane before turning
answer.mandarin: 在转弯之前移动到左车道

distractor_1.default: turn from the centre lane

distractor_2.default: turn from any lane

distractor_3.default: move to the right lane before turning
distractor_3.mandarin: 在转弯之前移动到右车道

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Using Lanes Correctly
question.source: Before you make a turn, you need to get your vehicle into the correct lane. Then you need to end up in the correct lane when you complete your turn.

text.default: After you have stopped at a steady red light, you may
text.mandarin: 在你停在红灯处之后，你可以

answer.default: turn right or turn left into a one-way street if it is safe and no signs prohibit it
answer.mandarin: 向右转或者向左转进入单行道，如果安全并且没有标志禁止

distractor_1.default: drive straight through

distractor_2.default: turn left or right

distractor_3.default: turn right only

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Watch for signs prohibiting you from making these turns on a red light.

text.default: What should you be prepared to do when being passed on a two lane road?
text.mandarin: 在双车道道路上被超车时，你应该做好准备

answer.default: slow down and make room so that they may safely pass
answer.mandarin: 减速并腾出空间，让他们能够安全超车

distractor_1.default: speed up to prevent them passing

distractor_2.default: maintain your speed at all times

distractor_3.default: maintain your speed while driving on the shoulder of the road
distractor_3.mandarin: 在路肩上行驶时保持你的速度

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Passing

text.default: What should the driver of Car A do?
text.mandarin: 汽车A的驾驶员应该怎么做？

answer.default: Slow down and stop.
answer.mandarin: 减速并停车。

distractor_1.default: Speed up to get through the crosswalk before the pedestrians step off the curb.
distractor_1.mandarin: 加速以在行人踏上人行横道前通过。

distractor_2.default: Honk to warn the pedestrian.

distractor_3.default: Slow down in case the pedestrians step into the crosswalk.
distractor_3.mandarin: 减速以防行人踏入人行横道。

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Pedestrians
question.source: You must yield to pedestrians in marked crosswalks, if the pedestrian is close to your half of the road.

text.default: In this traffic circle, the driver of Vehicle A wants to head down Street B. The correct path is
text.mandarin: 在这个交通环岛中，车辆A的驾驶员想要沿B街前行。正确的路径是

answer.default: to yield to traffic in the circle, turn right when safe, and exit right down Path B
answer.mandarin: 让交通环岛内的车辆优先通行，在安全的情况下右转，并沿B路径向右驶出

distractor_1.default: to turn left as soon as Motorcycle C passes by
distractor_1.mandarin: 等到摩托车C通过后立即左转

distractor_2.default: complete one full revolution of the traffic circle before exiting
distractor_2.mandarin: 在交通环岛内完整绕行一圈后再退出

distractor_3.default: to wait until the traffic circle is empty, then turn left
distractor_3.mandarin: 等待交通环岛内没有车辆后，然后左转

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: All vehicles must turn right to enter a traffic circle and right again to leave it.

text.default: Car A and Car B arrived at the stop sign at the same time. Who should go first?
text.mandarin: 汽车A和汽车B同时到达了停车标志。谁应该先行？

answer.default: Car B.
answer.mandarin: 汽车B。

distractor_1.default: Car A.

distractor_2.default: Both may move at the same time.

distractor_3.default: Both should wait for Car C to reach the intersection.
distractor_3.mandarin: 两辆车都应该等待汽车C到达路口。

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time, the one on the right should go first.

text.default: Car B arrived at the stop sign first. Who should go first?
text.mandarin: 汽车B先到达了停车标志。谁应该先行？

answer.default: Car B.
answer.mandarin: 汽车B。

distractor_1.default: Car A.

distractor_2.default: Car B should wave Car A through.
distractor_2.mandarin: 汽车B应该示意汽车A通过。

distractor_3.default: Both may go at the same time

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: The first vehicle to arrive at the intersection of a four-way stop and come to a complete stop should go first.

text.default: You are the driver of Car A and want to make a right turn. Which is the best See-Think-Do manoeuvre?
text.mandarin: 你是汽车A的驾驶员，想要右转。哪种是最好的看-思考-行动策略？

answer.default: I see cyclist B approaching; I think, "The cyclist may be at the corner when I want to turn."; I slow down.
answer.mandarin: 我看到自行车B正在靠近；我想，“当我想要转弯时，自行车可能已经在转角处”；我减速。

distractor_1.default: I see the corner ahead; I think "I'm going to be late for a meeting."; I accelerate and turn.
distractor_1.mandarin: 我看到前面的转角；我想，“我将迟到会议了”；我加速并转弯。

distractor_2.default: I see cyclist B; I think, "I can get to the corner first."; accelerate and turn.
distractor_2.mandarin: 我看到自行车B；我想，“我可以先到转角”；我加速并转弯。

distractor_3.default: I see cyclist B; I think, "I have the right of way."; I honk, and make the turn.
distractor_3.mandarin: 我看到自行车B；我想，“我有优先通行权”；我按喇叭并转弯。

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: Yield to cyclists as you would to any other vehicle. If you have the right-of-way at an intersection, proceed if it is safe.

text.default: The traffic signal has just turned yellow. There are no other vehicles around. Vehicle A should
text.mandarin: 交通信号灯刚刚变成黄色。周围没有其他车辆。车辆A应该

answer.default: slow down and stop since it is safe to do so
answer.mandarin: 减速并停车，因为这样做是安全的

distractor_1.default: speed up and make it through before it turns red
distractor_1.mandarin: 加速通过，以免它变成红色

distractor_2.default: scan the intersection, maintain speed, and go straight through
distractor_2.mandarin: 扫描路口，保持速度，直接通过

distractor_3.default: stop, and then proceed through the red light since there is no other traffic
distractor_3.mandarin: 停下来，然后通过红灯，因为没有其他车辆

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Yellow means that the signal is about the turn red. You must stop before entering the intersection unless you cannot safely stop in time.

text.default: Hand signals
text.mandarin: 手势信号

answer.default: should be used if turn signals are hard to see
answer.mandarin: 在转向灯难以看清时应该使用

distractor_1.default: should always be used in good weather
distractor_1.mandarin: 在好天气下应该始终使用

distractor_2.default: are only used by cyclists and motorcycle riders
distractor_2.mandarin: 仅由骑自行车和摩托车的人使用

distractor_3.default: will only confuse others and should not be used
distractor_3.mandarin: 只会让其他人困惑，不应该使用

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Communication
question.source: There are times when an automatic turn signal is hard to see in these situations, use a hand signal in addition to the turn signal.

text.default: Before making a left turn, a driver should
text.mandarin: 在进行左转之前，驾驶员应该

answer.default: yield to oncoming traffic and wait for a safe gap
answer.mandarin: 给对向行驶的车辆让路，并等待一个安全的间隙

distractor_1.default: signal any drivers behind to pass
distractor_1.mandarin: 向后面的车辆示意让行

distractor_2.default: make sure there are no cars behind

distractor_3.default: wait for oncoming drivers to wave you through
distractor_3.mandarin: 等待对向驾驶员示意让你通过

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: When making a left turn on a green light, you must yield to oncoming traffic and wait for a safe gap before you turn.

text.default: When you see a solid white line on your left it means
text.mandarin: 当你在左侧看到一条实线时，意味着

answer.default: you may not changes lanes
answer.mandarin: 你不能变换车道

distractor_1.default: it is separating traffic going in different directions.
distractor_1.mandarin: 它是分隔不同方向行驶的车辆的

distractor_2.default: you may pass with caution.

distractor_3.default: only public transit vehicles may pass.
distractor_3.mandarin: 只有公共交通车辆可以超车。

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: White lines are used to separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. A solid line means do not change lanes.

text.default: The driver of Car A should
text.mandarin: 汽车A的驾驶员应该

answer.default: enter freeway at the speed of traffic flow
answer.mandarin: 以交通流速度进入高速公路

distractor_1.default: move into the far left lane as soon as possible

distractor_2.default: drive faster than traffic flow to better maneuver
distractor_2.mandarin: 比交通流速度更快地行驶以更好地操控

distractor_3.default: slow down before entering the freeway
distractor_3.mandarin: 在进入高速公路前减速

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Highway or Freeway Entrances and Exits
question.source: A highway entrance gives you a short distance to match your speed to the vehicles already on the highway.

text.default: In the ACCELERATION lane before merging on to a highway, a driver should
text.mandarin: 在加速车道上，驶入高速公路之前，驾驶员应该

answer.default: speed up to match the speed of traffic.
answer.mandarin: 加速以匹配交通速度。

distractor_1.default: signal and pull into the flow of traffic.

distractor_2.default: only be looking straight ahead.

distractor_3.default: be looking in the rear view mirror.

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Highway or Freeway Entrances and Exits
question.source: The acceleration lane is divided from the rest of the roadway by a solid white line. Use this lane to match your speed to the speed of the traffic on the freeway.

text.default: When exiting a highway you should slow down
text.mandarin: 当退出高速公路时，你应该减速

answer.default: after you are in the exit lane.
answer.mandarin: 当你已经进入出口车道之后。

distractor_1.default: before you are in the exit lane.
distractor_1.mandarin: 在你进入出口车道之前。

distractor_2.default: before you signal your intention to turn off the highway.

distractor_3.mandarin: 只有在你后面有车辆时。

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road
question.source: Signal your intention to turn off the highway, maintaining your speed until you enter the exit lane. Then slow down gradually as you prepare to enter roads with lower speed limits.

question.source: Environmental elements like rain and ice contribute to skidding, but poor driving skills are the main cause of skidding. The way to avoid skids is to use your see-think-do skills.

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Most warning signs are yellow and diamond-shaped. They warn of possible hazards ahead.
